intro: [WRONG START] Ormorsia costulata, commonly known as the broad-leafed ormosia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces woody pods that contain elliptical, flat seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
